data.title: Pleasant neighborhood restaurant
data.text:
This pleasant sport bar and restaurant lots of interesting small plates and entrees.  We enjoyed what we ordered, 
The staff is friendly as is the bar.

data.title: Mixed review
data.text:
First time here, visiting relatives in San Mateo. Vibe was good, lots of folks having fun but not crazy noisy. We ordered a bunch of small plates for the 4 of us; there was no discussion by the server of pacing the meal. So basically 8 small plates arrived on our tiny table within less than 10 minutes - weird to have a charcuterie plate at the same time as the truffle fries as the asian slaw. So that was a disappointment.

The truffle fries were super good, as was the charcuterie; the asian slaw lacked zing or character, and the short ribs were a bit lackluster. Desserts were good.

Not sure if this was an off night, but I think this restaurant could have done much better

data.title: Was just So So
data.text:
After much hype from friends, we decided to go there.  The food was ok.  I have had much better for the price. 
Service was slow and served with a bit of unnecessary attitude.  It seemed like we were bothering her by asking for items.  Maybe because she had better things to text to her friends.

data.title: Re-visit Block 34 for the Craft Cocktails!
data.text: This bar has a new bartender, and he promises that the cocktail menu by June is going to be re-vamped for which I'm enthusiastically planning another happy hour visit.  My friends and I ate our usual and delicious pork belly bites, white truffle fries and oysters, but I also imbibed a drink called the Last Word--which Saveur says is "Equal parts gin, chartreuse, maraschino liqueur, and fresh lime juice, this is an old-fashioned cocktail that feels awfully modern."  I say it was awfully beautiful in taste.

data.title: Tasty and Interesting Happy Hour
data.text: Reunited with a friend and colleague around 5:30 for happy hour--plenty of seating and we chose to sit at the oyster bar.  We ordered Chardonnay and a Key Lime Martini and then dug into Smoked Salmon Lettuce Cups (smoky but not my favorite app), Pork Belly Bites with Peanut Sauce (very delicious though rather petite), Herb Fries with Sriracha Aioli (I was underwhelmed but my friend loved it) and White Truffle Fries (OMG delish).  I also ordered 2 oysters--a Kumamoto and Flap Jack and I'm definitely coming back with the husband to the oyster bar and to sample the $1 oysters.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: We celebrated our anniversary at Block 34 last night and loved it! The food (especially the pork belly bites and duck wings) was really good; the margarita was excellent; and the service was outstanding!

data.title: Great food & atmosphere.  Open till midnight
data.text: I can't believe how great this place is.  Not only was the food and service great but it was a fun atmosphere that is open till midnight.  The raw bar kicks butt!

data.title: Good food, but oh my goodness this place is slow
data.text:
We have eaten here twice. Both times we had good food but we waited forever for both drinks and food.  They were not terribly crowded and seemed to have plenty of servers, but it took 15 minutes just to get water after asking twice. 

The chef (owner?) came out to speak to us and was very friendly and informative. 

We had to refeed the parking meter since it took so long to get our food. It took 10 minutes to find out they didn't have the drink I ordered. The server made an error on our bill and after taking a long time to ring up the bill, I still had to send her back to fix the error.  

I want to like this place, I really do.  The atmosphere is nice, the food is good, the menu is interesting, but I can't deal with the incompetent and painfully slow service.

data.title: long wait time good food
data.text: while the service was amazing I feel that the kitchen staff was ill prepared for the rush of people. so be sure to make a reservation ahead of time

data.title: Good quality food
data.text:
We had heard mixed reviews from friends that have been to Block 34 so we were not sure what to expect. Some had said it was a bit noisy and more of a bar scene but when we went it was a good balance of both. Not all of the tables full and a relatively full bar but with out much noise. 

We really like the Brussels sprout chips, tasty but not filling, for a snack appetizer. The rib eye steak was tender and juicy. The pork chop was very flavorful but a bit salty for my taste. 

They have a large selection of whiskey and bar selections along with some wines on tap by the glass or better yet by the three wine flight for $10 for white and I think $13 for the red.  

Our only drawback was a substitution for the sides on one plate because they were out of what was on the menu but they didn't mention it when we ordered. They did bring an alternate when we questioned it.

data.title: Cool place.
data.text: Good weekend vibes - block party theme with dj today. Devin and Alex, the owners, are super approachable too. Do it.

data.title: Delicious lunch!
data.text: A revamped former restaurant right smack in the middle of 4th avenue San Mateo in a perfect place for lunch. Sleek, modern crisp style, good wait staff. A delicious Salmon Nicoise which wifey said had one of the tastiest piece of salmon ever. And we eat lots of it, living in the Pacific NW. An equally tasty and not over stuffed BLT on a delicious roll was the other half of the meal. Nice wine list, decent prices. A nice find.

data.title: Enjoyable weekend bar meals
data.text: Another San Mateo place with an interesting menu that proved excellent for a weekend light meal and a few drinks in convivial company. One of our party had the excellent Wagyu Beef hamburger, which came with a massive pile of fresh fries ; another had oysters which came very fresh with sauces; tow of us had the house chop salad - again fresh, quite substantial and tasty. We shared a kumquat pannacotta desert which was divine!

data.title: More of a Bar Scene
data.text: Too Loud!  You walk into this restaurant (essentially a large room in which the bar is the centerpiece) and the acoustics are such that, on a busy night, it sounds like the roar of a football stadium.  In addition, they blast their music.  What is with new restaurants blasting music?  Are they trying to attract only young single people?  What normal couple wants to scream at each other in order to be heard from across the table?  The menu is limited but has gluten free selections.  Most of the gluten free items still need adjusting to avoid dairy -which they did adjust.  I had the sense that they were respectful of allergies.  My beet salad was nice and my pork dish was average.  The salmon was not memorable.  We left thinking it was not a bad place but not a restaurant we would ever return to.  It is better suited for the type of people interested in Happy Hour and noise.

data.title: Great find
data.text: My husband and I were looking for a fun lunch spot in San Mateo and really enjoyed Block 34. The menu, while limited, had great choices. I enjoyed a chop salad while he loved his chicken sandwich and homemade chips. We will return!

data.title: Quality food, service, and atmosphere - come here for wine tasting!
data.text: After a bad experience at Amour Amour, we walked a few blocks and ran across this gem of a restaurant.  Quite a few wines on tap, with a tasting of any 3 for $10.00 with very generous pours.  All food offerings were strong with an excellent squash soup, a tasty hamburger, and an innovative cauliflower vegetarian entree gracing our dinner table that evening.  There also offer an extensive seafood bar with everything on full display, and plenty of great happy hour options including .99 oysters.  Varied seating options include counter, bar, table, and communal seating.  Come.  Eat.  Here.

data.title: Better bar than restaurant
data.text: I like the space, and they always seem to have good, innovative cocktails (as well as wine on tap, if you like that kid of thing).  The service is friendly, if not always particularly professional (still learning?) and the food is OK, but in my three visits so far, I'd put most dishes in the B-/B range, with just a few in the B+/A- range.  Hopefully, they'll improve with time, as it's great having a place like this that's a little bit away from the congestion (and parking nightmares) of San Mateo's downtown movie theater area.

data.title: Must try - Block 34
data.text: We had the opportunity to recently dine at the new Block 34 locally sustainable restaurant in San Mateo.  This was our second visit within a month, because of such a fantastic first experience.  The food was phenomenal, atmosphere great and they have a number of fantastic reasonably priced wines (try the Cuvee Cabernet).  We met the owner and chef, Alex, who was friendly and personable, as well as had great suggestions on pairing the food and wine.  The wait staff was attentive, the ambience hip and cool, and the price a deal compared to other restaurants of this caliber.  Overall, we had a wonderful experience at Block 34 and highly recommend it to anyone who is a foodie and likes wine!

data.title: New in San Mateo
data.text:
Block 34. First time in this new restaurant. Nice Big Bar with a nice selection for Happy Hour. I was here for a friends Birthday celebration and we ordered everything from the Happy Hour menu. The hamburger sliders were the size of a regular hamburger, very tasty.
Everything was delicious and the service was Excellent!

Make sure you leave room for dessert!!!

data.title: Off to a great start!
data.text: It's great to have a new restaurant in downtown San Mateo that isn't another sushi or frozen yogurt establishment.  The owner of Block 34 comes from a classically trained background, and has a great selection of locally sourced california cuisine.  They've also decorated the place with reclaimed wood, although I think the seating is a bit too close for comfort.
